content: This question might betray I need to revise some abstract algebra, but isn't the entry for Ring Theory/Algebra over a commutative ring subsumed by the Mathlib definition of an Algebra?
It is complicated because there are so many variations. The definition you linked to assumed associativity and a unit.

For the definition of Algebra proper yes, but further down it describes an approach that works for the non-unital, non-associative case. So would it suffice to repackage that in a more user friendly way, rather than defining a whole new typeclass "from scratch"?
We had this discussion many times and it never converged. I think it's fine to put a definition in Mathlib simply do that we can point people to it, with a docstring explaining the situation.
Luigi Massacci has marked this topic as resolved.
